result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius Dequan Barfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 01/13/16 or a civil judgment.

Time served disposition.
*Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes payment of costs, fees and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darius Dequan Barfield

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes payment of costs, fees and surcharges.

Defendant Darius Dequan Barfield in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Morgan Wilz, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 1-13-2016 or a civil judgment. 

Court will consider motion for expungement  if defendant successfully completes payment of costs, fees and surcharges.

Defendant Darius Dequan Barfield in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Student Intern Maureen Wills under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Scheduling conference held.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darius Dequan Barfield in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Pretrial conference held. Defense counsel requests case be set for scheduling conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.   Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; and no possession of any illegal substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Darius Dequan Barfield in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-13-2015 at 1:30pm
